entry.title: Blog Setup
entry.content: I have just started to rewrite my blog using Sphinx and its extension Ablog. As an extra, I have setup a part of the blog as a Zettelkasten – which is more or less a glorified wiki –, and also I have configured Emacs to write posts in Org mode and export them to Restructured Text, which is what Sphinx expects.

entry.title: How is this blog deployed
entry.content: This blog is deployed to Github Pages from this Github repository, and then served under a sub-domain (a www sub-domain) of a domain that I host at Amazon Route 53.

entry.title: Setting up a development environment for Gerbil Scheme and Doom Emacs
entry.content: There is an installation guide and a page about development with Emacs in the Gerbil Scheme website, but I felt it was centered on plain Emacs and not on variants like Doom Emacs – which is fine, of course, I just happen to prefer Doom because it has a focus on Vim keybindings and I am much more used to them than to plain Emacs chords.
